Description: Rim, body and handle sherd (mended from 14 fragments) of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; foot missing; interior glazed save for reserved band at rim; exterior glazed save for lip, handle zone and inside of handle; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B2
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer identifies the sherd as belonging to a Type 9A South Ionian cup with everted rim. The type closely follows the shape and decoration of the Attic Plain Komast cups. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18), Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-6), and Villard’s Ionian Cup Type B2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-8). Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus and the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. The number 198 is written in ink on the exterior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 198)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 659, no. 159)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 50, no. 125, p. 99, NAU 47, pl.10, no. i)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.323) (Phase 3)
